newsitem.title: USA: Albright plans talks on Canada salmon issue.
newsitem.headline: Albright plans talks on Canada salmon issue.

text.p: Secretary of State Madeleine Albright said on Friday she planned to talk with Canadian Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy on the breakdown of Pacific salmon negotiations between the two countries.
"We have obviously wanted these talks to go forward in a way that the stakeholders there would feel that their rights have been looked at properly," she told a news conference.
"I am going to be talking with Foreign Minister Axworthy about this issue, in fact we were supposed to do it yesterday and I couldn't," she added.

Canada announced on Wednesday it had suspended the negotiations and said would enforce minor restrictions against U.S. fishing vessels travelling through its waters. The two countries have been at odds for years over how to divide the salmon catch in the Pacific Northwest.
Fishermen have voiced concern that dwindling stocks would be further endangered when the salmon run begins in July if the matter is not resolved.

Albright's comments were in response to a question on whether British Columbia might be considering some type of unilateral retaliation in the matter, perhaps even terminating the lease for a U.S. weaspons testing facility there.
"We obviously do not want it to reach the kinds of proprotions that you are discussing," she said.
